summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It details the procedures for public and press access via audio feed and limited in-person viewing at the courthouse, with specific provisions for alleged victims and family members.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this court order is issued, scheduling her arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the court order, detailing the logistics for the upcoming remote proceedings in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Remote Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: A video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell at 1 pm.

events.title: Previous Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued a previous order referenced in this document, which likely addressed initial procedures for the case.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell for July 14, 2020.
Public and press access to the hearing is provided via a live audio phone feed, with capacity for approximately 500 callers.
Limited in-person viewing (approx. 60 seats) is available at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, subject to COVID-19 safety protocols.
The order includes specific provisions for alleged victims, allowing them to be heard at the bail hearing as entitled under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771(a)(4).
The order is issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Southern District of New York, case number 20-CR-330.
